messages.content: ComfyUI-WhisperX is a custom node for audio subtitling in ComfyUI, based on whisperX and translators.
What are the main features of ComfyUI-WhisperX?

ComfyUI-WhisperX supports exporting srt files for subtitles, translation using translators with a large number of engines, multiple speaker diarization using pyannote-audio, and the ability to merge huge ComfyUI custom nodes into whisperx.
What are the prerequisites for using ComfyUI-WhisperX?

To use ComfyUI-WhisperX, you need to have ffmpeg installed and working in your command line. You also need to clone the ComfyUI-WhisperX repository, install the required packages using pip, and ensure that the weights are downloaded from Hugging Face.
How can users in China download the weights for ComfyUI-WhisperX?
Users in China can try following the instructions on hf-mirror.com to configure their environment and download the weights.
What steps are needed to enable speaker diarization in ComfyUI-WhisperX?
To enable speaker diarization, users need to accept the user conditions for pyannote/segmentation-3.0 and pyannote/speaker-diarization-3.1, and create an access token at hf.co/settings/tokens.
Is there a tutorial available for ComfyUI-WhisperX?
Yes, a demo tutorial for ComfyUI-WhisperX is available at https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV19i421y7jb/.
Which repositories is ComfyUI-WhisperX based on?
ComfyUI-WhisperX is based on the whisperX and translators repositories.
